PAD_Massacre_2P.synopsis: PAD for two character when the player enters the area with massacred tieflings.Two variations - player knows about Father Lorgan helping the tieflings and player doesn't know about Father Lorgan helping the tieflings.

Yannis.synopsis: Dialog with Yannis, one of the priestess of Ilmater. It seems that with father Lorgan dead she took some of his responsibilities.This dialog is available after you participated in a threeway dialog with her and father Lorgan.
Yannis.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AClick on |Yannis| - S_WYR_OpenHand_Yannis - cb5ad2e6-40e9-4377-9669-1c4e4b1106e0 - (-45 45 -6)This will trigger a threeway dialog between Yannis, Valerio and the player. Afterwards Valerior leaves and you can click on Yannis again to get this dialog.

AD_ArguingPriests.synopsis: You see priests who are arguing.The head priest was killed recently. One of the priests thinks that he was too welcoming to refugees, the other one disagrees.

PAD_LorgansChestDoubleBottom.synopsis: The player says this if they open Lorgan's chest and then succeed on a passive investigation check.
PAD_LorgansChestDoubleBottom.how_to_trigger: Open Wooden Chest - S_WYR_OpenHand_LorgansChest - fa41b720-f976-41ab-81bb-5d2b70b9136e - (-91 41 -5)Succeed on the passive check

Shifter_001_Dead.synopsis: SwD with one of the Shifters that were sent to retrieve the dagger of the serial killer from the tunnels underneath the Open Hand temple.
Shifter_001_Dead.how_to_trigger: TBDfor now - goto 39; -8; -1012kill the shifterscast SwD on the main shifter.

PAD_PickedUpDagger.synopsis: Player makes a comment after picking up Dargger of Paralysing.The specific AD depends on whether we know that Father Lorgan was killed with a dagger or not.This AD only happens if you know that Father Lorgan was killed.
PAD_PickedUpDagger.how_to_trigger: SetGlobalOsirisFlag WYR_OpenHand_Knows_Murdergoto 63.442; -11.218; -1025.394kill the shiftersloot the Dagger of Paralysing from one of the shifters

ArguingPriest_001.synopsis: One-liner with a priest that is arguing with his colleague, after the player participated in their group dialog; "Some of them want to flee to the city, but others say they can't just abandon the temple, especially with their wounded head priest hovering between life and death"This priest considers fleeing.
ArguingPriest_001.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AClick on |Arguing Priest 001| - S_WYR_OpenHand_ArguingPriest_001 5f71634a-6ed0-4f68-933e-a4ef9b79d620 - (-23; 45; 3)This will start a group dialog with him and another priest. Wait for it to end and then click on the priest again.

PAD_Massacre_1P.synopsis: PAD for one character when the player enters the area with massacred tieflings.Two variations - player knows about Father Lorgan helping the tieflings and player doesn't know about Father Lorgan helping the tieflings.

AD_TemplePlaque.synopsis: Sign of Open Hand temple.Says "TEMPLE CLOSED".

PriestNovice.synopsis: Priest Novice in front of Open Hand temple.Will tell you the temple is closed for business on account of there having been a terrible murder. Their colleague was stabbed by a refugee, so they've closed the soup kitchen and are refusing to consort with refugees any further.We might want have him sending you to Yannis ("if you have any other questions - ask sister Yannis, she is inside".)

Donnick.synopsis: Dialog with a priest cleaning the kitchen.Donnick is feeling sorry for Father Lorgan, but also for himself - he'd hoped to find in this temple a sanctuary from the world's troubles (and his poor life choices), but the world's troubles have come knocking at his door.

AD_ShiftersIdle.synopsis: Discussion between a group of shifters at the place where Dolor attacked Father Lorgan and Brilgor.

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective.synopsis: AD between Yannis and Valeria where they discuss the murder of father Lorgan.

PAD_BloodiedFlowerKey.synopsis: VB when the player finds the bloodied flower key in the tunnels underneath the temple of the Open Hand, but only if they had picked up a flower key in the Flophouse before.
PAD_BloodiedFlowerKey.how_to_trigger: goto -13; 43; 78pick up one of the flower keysgoto 37; -8; -1013kill the shifters, pick up the bloodied flower key from the body of one of them

Rose.synopsis: Sister Rose tells you that Father Lorgan was found on the kitchen floor, stabbed. The wound wasn't that deep but it wouldn't stop bleeding and it couldn't be healed, not even by curative spells.

AD_ShiftersAttack.synopsis: AD that happens when the shifters see you approaching the place where the Serial Killer performed his ritual.

ArguingPriests.synopsis: You see priests who are arguing.The head priest was killed recently. One of the priests thinks that he was too welcoming to refugees, the other one disagrees.
ArguingPriests.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AClick on |Arguing Priest 001| - S_WYR_OpenHand_ArguingPriest_001 5f71634a-6ed0-4f68-933e-a4ef9b79d620 - (-23; 45; 3)OR|Arguing Priest 002| - S_WYR_OpenHand_ArguingPriest_002 888f7b75-bae2-487b-a631-aad7be93a29b - (-25; 45; 2)

Refugee_Dead.synopsis: SwD with Brilgor, tiefling refugee that was killed by the serial killer.
Refugee_Dead.how_to_trigger: goto -115; 41; -7dig out the grave (?)Cast SwD on the corpse

ArguingPriest_002.synopsis: One-liner with a priest that is arguing with his colleague, after the player participated in their group dialog; "Some of them want to flee to the city, but others say they can't just abandon the temple, especially with their wounded head priest hovering between life and death"This priest considers staying.
ArguingPriest_002.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AClick on |Arguing Priest 002| - S_WYR_OpenHand_ArguingPriest_002 888f7b75-bae2-487b-a631-aad7be93a29b - (-25; 45; 2)This will start a group dialog between him and his colleague. Wait for it to end and then click on him again.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective.synopsis: Group dialog with priestess Yannis and the hollyphant detective.The tollyphant tells Yannis that she has solved the crime and leaves afterwards.!!! It is possible for the player to solve the murder case before this dialog happens, so we need to have a reactivity to it.

HollyphantDetective.synopsis: Dialog with Valeria, the hollyphant detective. Happens in Temple of Illmater IF Yannis is not avaiable (due to crime reactions or something similar). Fallback version, because the main dialog YannisAndHollyphantDetective should usually launch.If Yannis dies to the player shenanigans then Valeria leaves to Sharess Caress.
HollyphantDetective.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ACtrl+Shift+K |Yannis| - S_WYR_OpenHand_Yannis - cb5ad2e6-40e9-4377-9669-1c4e4b1106e0 - (-45 45 -6)Then click on the hollyphant.

PAD_Massacre_2P_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Massacre_2P_1.text: I think these were the people Father Lorgan was trying to help.

PAD_Massacre_2P_2.speaker: Player
PAD_Massacre_2P_2.text: With the state of these bodies, not even a priest could help them now.

PAD_Massacre_2P_3.speaker: Player
PAD_Massacre_2P_3.text: Looks like these people were trying to hide in the tunnels here.

Yannis_15.speaker: Player
Yannis_15.text: Tell Yannis what you've found so far.

Yannis_87.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_87.text: So there were assassins under the temple working with the real killer? If only we could prove that to Valeria...

Yannis_55.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_55.text: Assassins under this temple is certainly unnerving news, thank you for taking care of them.

Yannis_47.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_47.text: Talking to the victims' corpses was clever, but I don't know if Valeria will accept that testimony.

Yannis_62.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_62.text: The real killer's name was Dolor? Shame we have no hard proof of that.

Yannis_37.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_37.text: I suppose it's not a surprise that this temple has tunnels underneath - Rivington's chock full of them.

Yannis_40.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_40.text: You're on the right track. Please, keep looking.

Yannis_86.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_86.text: Gods... That's worrying. I knew this went deeper than Brilgor and Lorgan.

Yannis_64.speaker: Player
Yannis_64.text: Here's the murder weapon - it was in some secret tunnels under the temple.

Yannis_6.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_6.text: That's it! Proof that Valeria missed something. They'll have to listen to you now.

Yannis_91.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_91.text: If you can convince them of Brilgor's innocence then... Perhaps Ilmater could shed one less tear this day.

Yannis_71.speaker: Player
Yannis_71.text: Father Lorgan is on this list of murder targets I found. Looks like more killings are planned.

Yannis_17.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_17.text: By His holy tears... That's - that's terrifying.

Yannis_25.speaker: Player
Yannis_25.text: I'm still looking - any advice on where to begin?

Yannis_33.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_33.text: The killing happened in the kitchen cellar. Could be a good place to start.

Yannis_70.speaker: Player
Yannis_70.text: What do I need to prove Brilgor's innocence?

Yannis_89.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_89.text: Valeria never found the murder weapon - that would be definitive proof that they missed something.

Yannis_53.speaker: Player
Yannis_53.text: I need to know where the bodies are.

Yannis_11.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_11.text: The temple's not open for public worship right now, sorry. Not until we replace Father Lorgan.
Yannis_11.context: NodeContext: pause before "passing" - it should be painful for her to say

Yannis_69.speaker: Player
Yannis_69.text: I'm here about Lorgan. I want to solve his murder.

Yannis_43.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_43.text: You're too late, I'm afraid. The Investigator has been and gone.

Yannis_80.speaker: Player
Yannis_80.text: What do you usually worship here?

Yannis_20.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_20.text: You must be new here - quite the time to be passing through.

Yannis_9.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_9.text: Here, we give thanks to Ilmater. Well, we did, until our high priest... Until he...
Yannis_9.context: NodeContext: she can't quite get the words out

Yannis_78.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_78.text: One of the refugees - a tiefling called Brilgor - killed Father Lorgan. Allegedly. Doesn't add up to me.
Yannis_78.context: NodeContext: she struggles through this, recounting it is very raw still

Yannis_57.speaker: Player
Yannis_57.text: You're in luck. A Bhaalist serial killer in the Lower City claimed he murdered Lorgan - not this refugee.

Yannis_38.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_38.text: Bhaal's got a bloody history with this city. How exactly does this news make me lucky?

Yannis_46.speaker: Player
Yannis_46.text: I scattered his brains across the Lower City cobbles, that's how.

Yannis_58.speaker: Player
Yannis_58.text: Knowledge is power. Also, he's dead.

Yannis_82.speaker: Player
Yannis_82.text: He only killed one of your priests, not the entire temple.

Yannis_28.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_28.text: If there are Bhaalists on the loose, Investigator Valeria will want to know. They're at Sharess' Caress right now.

Yannis_19.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_19.text: Investigator Valeria. Used to be on the ball, but this time... I'm unsure.

Yannis_3.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_3.text: Thank you. It just - it doesn't make sense.

Yannis_1.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_1.text: He risked everything for those refugees. Doesn't make sense for one of them to kill him.

Yannis_39.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_39.text: Besides, Brilgor wouldn't know which end to hold the dagger. He's no killer.

Yannis_35.speaker: Player
Yannis_35.text: Lorgan's murderer was a Bhaalist serial killer. I stopped him.

Yannis_67.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_67.text: Ilmater grants us small mercies on occasion.

Yannis_21.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_21.text: Report this to Investigator Valeria in Sharess' Caress. It's only right they know.

Yannis_48.speaker: Player
Yannis_48.text: So what do you think really happened?

Yannis_23.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_23.text: Wish I knew. Not that my opinion matters.

Yannis_14.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_14.text: Have a look around. If you find something that'll change their mind, they'll be at Sharess' Caress.

Yannis_2.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_2.text: Lorgan's in the room behind us, with Sister Rose. Brilgor's buried out back, through the kitchen and the dormitories.

Yannis_7.speaker: Player
Yannis_7.text: Can you tell me where Lorgan was killed?

Yannis_44.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_44.text: In the cellar. You can get down there through Brother Donnick's kitchen. Good luck.

Yannis_29.speaker: Player
Yannis_29.text: Perhaps I could investigate - make sure nothing was missed?

Yannis_51.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_51.text: You can try. Maybe the Investigator will listen to you.

Yannis_18.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_18.text: Thank you. Now Brilgor's name has been cleared, we can extend our help to the refugees once more.

Yannis_74.speaker: Player
Yannis_74.text: I need to speak with an initiate of yours - Shirra Clarwen - where is she?

Yannis_66.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_66.text: Shirra? I can tell you where to find her, but you might find the conversation rather one-sided.

Yannis_61.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_61.text: She's buried in the temple crypt. Passed only last year, poor thing.

Yannis_54.speaker: Player
Yannis_54.text: I want to help you clear Brilgor's name.

Yannis_49.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_49.text: Thank you - Ilmater smiles upon us this day. Feel free to look around the temple.

Yannis_32.speaker: Player
Yannis_32.text: No, sorry, I'll leave you be.

Yannis_50.speaker: Sister Yannis
Yannis_50.text: Please, go talk to the Investigator. The sooner we clear Brilgor's name, the better.

AD_ArguingPriests_0.speaker: Brother Bill
AD_ArguingPriests_0.text: I warned the Temple of exactly this. Exactly this.

AD_ArguingPriests_2.speaker: Brother Clements
AD_ArguingPriests_2.text: Ilmater's edict is to welcome all into his embrace. Salve all suffering.

AD_ArguingPriests_1.speaker: Brother Bill
AD_ArguingPriests_1.text: By allowing his faithful to suffer the most?

AD_ArguingPriests_6.speaker: Brother Clements
AD_ArguingPriests_6.text: It is not for us to decide who deserves Ilmater's grace.

AD_ArguingPriests_5.speaker: Brother Bill
AD_ArguingPriests_5.text: Why not? We are his adherents - who would know if not us?

AD_ArguingPriests_3.speaker: Brother Clements
AD_ArguingPriests_3.text: To claim to know the lord's will is blasphemy. We interpret scripture and teachings - but we know nothing.

AD_ArguingPriests_8.speaker: Brother Clements
AD_ArguingPriests_8.text: I'll hear nothing more against Father Lorgan.

AD_ArguingPriests_4.speaker: Brother Bill
AD_ArguingPriests_4.text: I've nothing against Father Lorgan, Ilmater rest his soul.

AD_ArguingPriests_7.speaker: Brother Bill
AD_ArguingPriests_7.text: But his methods need to rest with him. We need change.

PAD_LorgansChestDoubleBottom_0.speaker: Player
PAD_LorgansChestDoubleBottom_0.text: This chest is deeper than it looks... A double bottom. Of course.

Shifter_001_Dead_29.speaker: Narrator
Shifter_001_Dead_29.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Shifter_001_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
Shifter_001_Dead_25.text: *The corpse tries to speak, but something prevents it.*

Shifter_001_Dead_9.speaker: Player
Shifter_001_Dead_9.text: Why did you want this dagger so much?

Shifter_001_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Shifter_001_Dead_1.text: How many more of you are there?

Shifter_001_Dead_10.speaker: Narrator
Shifter_001_Dead_10.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Shifter_001_Dead_22.speaker: Player
Shifter_001_Dead_22.text: I found this flowery key. What is it for?

Shifter_001_Dead_34.speaker: Narrator
Shifter_001_Dead_34.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

PAD_PickedUpDagger_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PickedUpDagger_0.text: So much blood... Must be where Father Lorgan was slaughtered.

PAD_PickedUpDagger_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PickedUpDagger_1.text: This blade's wicked look matches its deeds - poor Father Lorgan.

ArguingPriest_001_0.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriest_001_0.text: If you're looking for a handout, try elsewhere. We're focusing on our own now.

ArguingPriest_001_1.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriest_001_1.text: We tried helping the refugees. Look how it turned out.

ArguingPriest_001_2.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriest_001_2.text: At least we found Father Lorgan's killer. Doesn't make me rest that easy, though.

PAD_Massacre_1P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Massacre_1P_0.text: Looks like Father Lorgan's help wasn't quite enough.

PAD_Massacre_1P_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Massacre_1P_1.text: Looks like they were trying to hide. Didn't work.

AD_TemplePlaque_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_TemplePlaque_0.text: *Temple worship suspended until further notice. The faithful endure.*

PriestNovice_0.speaker: Novice Bramble
PriestNovice_0.text: The Crying One weeps today. Our Father Lorgan is dead. Murdered!
PriestNovice_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: first ahem is her pulling herself together, italics @ end are her getting upset again NodeContext: first ahem is her pulling herself together, italics @ end are her getting upset again

PriestNovice_7.speaker: Novice Bramble
PriestNovice_7.text: I... I don't want to talk. My heart is in mourning.

PriestNovice_2.speaker: Novice Bramble
PriestNovice_2.text: But few as good as Father Lorgan.

PriestNovice_3.speaker: Novice Bramble
PriestNovice_3.text: At - at least we know who did it. Thank you.

PriestNovice_8.speaker: Novice Bramble
PriestNovice_8.text: M-may Ilmater guide your footfall, stranger.
PriestNovice_8.context: NodeContext: she is very sad. still crying

Donnick_1.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_1.text: It'll be nice to be back on soup duty. People really smile at you when they get hot soup.

Donnick_7.speaker: Player
Donnick_7.text: There are secret tunnels in the cellar. How do I open them?

Donnick_44.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_44.text: Not a clue. Rivington's riddled with old smuggler's tunnels and the like. I wouldn't go poking around in them if I were you.

Donnick_49.speaker: Player
Donnick_49.text: I found this key in the cellar. Any idea what it opens?

Donnick_19.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_19.text: Looks like a room key, maybe? Nothing in here, that's for sure.

Donnick_37.speaker: Player
Donnick_37.text: I found intruders in the tunnels - it got messy.

Donnick_46.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_46.text: Oh, good. More blood to clean up, I suppose.

Donnick_17.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_17.text: I've said all I have to say already - now I just want to pack up my kitchen and leave.

Donnick_32.speaker: Player
Donnick_32.text: I'm investigating Lorgan's murder. What do you know?

Donnick_33.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_33.text: I know it's not fair. This was the best job I ever had. Lorgan was kinder than most.

Donnick_28.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_28.text: And now they're blaming a refugee for his death. Typical.

Donnick_23.speaker: Player
Donnick_23.text: I spoke with Lorgan's corpse, where can I find Brilgor?

Donnick_11.speaker: Player
Donnick_11.text: I spoke with Brilgor's corpse, where can I find Lorgan?

Donnick_5.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_5.text: Brilgor. I think he'd nicked something - apparently the Fists were after him.

Donnick_13.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_13.text: He came a couple times for soup. Potato chowder was his favourite. Didn't seem the murderous type - but what do I know...

Donnick_0.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_0.text: Sister Rose has Lorgan in the infirmary. Preparing him for a decent burial.

Donnick_25.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_25.text: You could pop your head in and pay your respects.

Donnick_22.speaker: Player
Donnick_22.text: You already talked to the Investigator?

Donnick_36.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_36.text: Investigator? That miniature mastodon is about as much use as rats in the pantry or flies in the soup.

Donnick_31.speaker: Player
Donnick_31.text: Why are you packing up your kitchen?

Donnick_16.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_16.text: Soup kitchen's no good if we've no one to feed soup to. Besides...

Donnick_50.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_50.text: Father Lorgan's gone. Murdered - and now they're blaming a refugee for it.

Donnick_20.speaker: Player
Donnick_20.text: So you don't think Brilgor killed him?

Donnick_42.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_42.text: No! Brilgor was a nice bloke.

Donnick_47.speaker: Player
Donnick_47.text: Can you think of anyone who'd want to kill Lorgan?

Donnick_15.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_15.text: Some folk didn't like how he looked after the refugees, but I don't think they'd kill him for it.

Donnick_21.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_21.text: At least, I hope they wouldn't. That's a scary thought.

Donnick_41.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_41.text: He was attacked in the cellar. He had a private altar down there - used to like the solitude.

Donnick_24.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_24.text: The man ate like a horse. A soup-hungry horse. Usually took enough to feed a small clergy down there.

Donnick_29.speaker: Player
Donnick_29.text: I heard about some 'secret tunnels' where the attack took place - know anything about that?

Donnick_26.speaker: Player
Donnick_26.text: You should probably clean up the massive blood trail before you go.

Donnick_6.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_6.text: I'm not touching it. Not with a mop ten yards long - that's Father Lorgan's blood.

Donnick_34.speaker: Player
Donnick_34.text: Why've you got a priest's blood on the floor?

Donnick_30.speaker: Brother Donnick
Donnick_30.text: Look, I need to finish up here. Lots of soup to clean up. Blood, too.

AD_ShiftersIdle_0.speaker: Rudd
AD_ShiftersIdle_0.text: Well, what now, sir? We go check his place?

AD_ShiftersIdle_3.speaker: Zomm
AD_ShiftersIdle_3.text: Perhaps. We'll take one more look here, then move on to the Flophouse.

AD_ShiftersIdle_1.speaker: Muzz
AD_ShiftersIdle_1.text: Why does Dolor get all the finest weapons?

AD_ShiftersIdle_4.speaker: Zomm
AD_ShiftersIdle_4.text: You are a weapon, my sweet.

AD_ShiftersIdle_7.speaker: Muzz
AD_ShiftersIdle_7.text: A sharper one than Dolor. He spends too much time with his prey. He's going to get us caught.

AD_ShiftersIdle_6.speaker: Zomm
AD_ShiftersIdle_6.text: Dolor is an artist. You'd do well to think on that.

AD_ShiftersIdle_8.speaker: Zomm
AD_ShiftersIdle_8.text: Keep an eye out, brethren. It must be here somewhere.

AD_ShiftersIdle_2.speaker: Rudd
AD_ShiftersIdle_2.text: We never get the fun jobs, Zomm.

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_0.speaker: Sister Yannis
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_0.text: You're wrong about Father Lorgan's killer.

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_1.speaker: Valeria
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_1.text: Enough, Yannis. I don't teach you how to pray, so don't teach me how to investigate.

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_5.speaker: Sister Yannis
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_5.text: I still can't believe anyone would murder Father Lorgan.

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_4.speaker: Valeria
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_4.text: There's enough blood to make a believer out of anyone.
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_4.context: NodeContext: speaking frankly and insensitively about a horrible murder

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_2.speaker: Sister Yannis
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_2.text: By Ilmater's grace, must you be so insensitive?

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_7.speaker: Valeria
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_7.text: I have all the evidence I need.

AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_3.speaker: Sister Yannis
AD_YannisAndHollyphantDetective_3.text: You don't even have the murder weapon.

PAD_BloodiedFlowerKey_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BloodiedFlowerKey_0.text: This looks just like the key in the flophouse. Curious.

Rose_0.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_0.text: What ails you - marsh fever? Featherlung? Be quick - I've not got all day.
Rose_0.context: NodeContext: brusque, rude, to cover a bit of sadness

Rose_31.speaker: Player
Rose_31.text: I'm looking into Lorgan's death. I need to ask you some questions.

Rose_28.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_28.text: What do you want to know?

Rose_25.speaker: Player
Rose_25.text: Who do you think killed Father Lorgan?

Rose_9.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_9.text: I reckon Investigator Valeria is right.

Rose_19.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_19.text: They cut off his hand. Sawed through flesh and bone.

Rose_45.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_45.text: I found a paralytic poison on one of his wounds. Lorgan was alive while they took the hand, he just couldn't scream. It's sick.
Rose_45.context: NodeContext: she's in shock - think like a frontline doctor patching up soldiers in a triage centre

Rose_15.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_15.text: We give them everything, and all we get is nothing but a good man to bury.

Rose_41.speaker: Player
Rose_41.text: You don't seem that sad about his death.

Rose_6.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_6.text: I'm not sad. I'm angry. He dedicated his life to the needy - it shouldn't have ended like this.

Rose_21.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_21.text: I told Lorgan we didn't have enough to spare all the refugees. I knew it was a bad idea.

Rose_44.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_44.text: Now I've got a dead priest to deal with as well.

Rose_23.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_23.text: Slowly. Lorgan was a good man, if naive. He deserved better.

Rose_4.speaker: Player
Rose_4.text: I heard about Father Lorgan. I'm sorry.

Rose_5.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_5.text: I'm sorry, too. Sorry we ever let these heretics into our midst.

Rose_46.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_46.text: One of the refugees killed him. Cruelly, too - they cut off his hand, sawed right through the bone.
Rose_46.context: NodeContext: stammer just before "I think" due to grief

Rose_12.speaker: Player
Rose_12.text: Who do you think killed him?

Rose_2.speaker: Player
Rose_2.text: Do I look diseased to you?

Rose_26.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_26.text: Reckon so... There's something off about you, anyway. Might be brain rot.

Rose_29.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_29.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got a dead high priest to see to.

Rose_20.speaker: Player
Rose_20.text: Indeed - I'm investigating his death and have some questions.

Rose_18.speaker: Player
Rose_18.text: About that - I have some questions.

Rose_1.speaker: Player
Rose_1.text: A bad case of scale chafe.

Rose_16.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_16.text: You'd interrupt me for something like that? Just rub a bit of aloe on.

Rose_43.speaker: Player
Rose_43.text: My ear points are a bit dry right now.

Rose_14.speaker: Player
Rose_14.text: All the human ale's been making me gassy. Too many bubbles.

Rose_33.speaker: Player
Rose_33.text: I've been dealing with some anger issues recently.

Rose_30.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_30.text: Cures of temperament are a touch beyond my skill set, I'm afraid.

Rose_7.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_7.text: Please, leave me be. I've got an awful lot to get done.

Rose_34.speaker: Sister Rose the Penitent
Rose_34.text: Looks like we're opening back up to the refugees. No rest for the wicked.

ArguingPriests_23.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_23.text: We let more outsiders in, and more Baldurians die. Duke Stelmane, Father Lorgan; it's no coincidence!
ArguingPriests_23.context: NodeContext: almost like a muttered whisper - this is minorly blasphemous so he doesn't want everyone hearing. (Stelmane = STEL-mane.)

ArguingPriests_21.speaker: Halsin
ArguingPriests_21.text: Imagine fleeing to the city, only to be met with suspicion. The refugees face hardship at every turn.

ArguingPriests_0.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_0.text: We have faith here, Bill. Faith in people - no matter where they're from.

ArguingPriests_4.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_4.text: Who had more faith than Father Lorgan? How did that work out?
ArguingPriests_4.context: NodeContext: getting more upset and loud, emphasis on 'that'

ArguingPriests_25.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_25.text: What are you two talking about?

ArguingPriests_24.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_24.text: Our high priest was harbouring fugitives, and one of them murdered him.
ArguingPriests_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: He begins addressing the other priest during this

ArguingPriests_10.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_10.text: Sounds like it didn't work out great.

ArguingPriests_2.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_2.text: Is there any victim more fitting, than one who would forgive his own murderer?

ArguingPriests_26.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_26.text: Exactly. Lorgan let a killer into our temple due to his misguided compassion - his faith got him murdered.

ArguingPriests_17.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_17.text: He was murdered. Or so I've heard.

ArguingPriests_5.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_5.text: I heard your priest died. My condolences.

ArguingPriests_27.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_27.text: Thank you, stranger. Father Lorgan's passing has saddened us all.

ArguingPriests_9.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_9.text: 'Passing'? He was murdered. By one of the fugitives he was harbouring.
ArguingPriests_9.context: NodeContext: 'pass' said with incredulity and sarcasm

ArguingPriests_3.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_3.text: Bill, I beg you, be quiet.
ArguingPriests_3.context: NodeContext: whispered to bill in hushed tones

ArguingPriests_15.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_15.text: Even sinners receive Ilmater's grace, and Father Lorgan knew that. We don't pick and choose who we aid.

ArguingPriests_28.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_28.text: If Father Lorgan had been pickier, he might still been alive.

ArguingPriests_12.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_12.text: Father Lorgan instructed us to welcome everyone. That was his edict - that is Ilmater's edict.
ArguingPriests_12.context: NodeContext: getting angry now, pissed at player for being cheeky after the high priest died

ArguingPriests_19.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_19.text: All I'm saying is we'd be a lot better off without murderous refugees roaming -

ArguingPriests_18.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Priest 02 turrns to address the player at the end hereNodeContext: losing his patience with Bill here

ArguingPriests_13.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_13.text: I'm sorry you had to witness our squabbling. Our temple is open to you - walk well.

ArguingPriests_22.speaker: Player
ArguingPriests_22.text: Sounds like your god would be proud of Father Lorgan.

ArguingPriests_20.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_20.text: Thank you, stranger. I take some solace knowing that he died in Ilmater's service.

ArguingPriests_14.speaker: Brother Bill
ArguingPriests_14.text: Does Ilmater's service involve protecting heretic Absolutists? Perhaps I missed that sermon -

ArguingPriests_11.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriests_11.text: You seem a kind soul. Our temple is open to you - walk well.

Refugee_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
Refugee_Dead_4.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Refugee_Dead_35.speaker: Brilgor
Refugee_Dead_35.text: Never... He was... Kinder than most...

Refugee_Dead_38.speaker: Player
Refugee_Dead_38.text: What were you protecting Lorgan from?

Refugee_Dead_13.speaker: Player
Refugee_Dead_13.text: Why did the killer want Lorgan?

Refugee_Dead_41.speaker: Narrator
Refugee_Dead_41.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Refugee_Dead_33.speaker: Brilgor
Refugee_Dead_33.text: Tunnels... Beneath temple... Hidden from sight...

Refugee_Dead_21.speaker: Player
Refugee_Dead_21.text: How do I find these tunnels?

Refugee_Dead_42.speaker: Brilgor
Refugee_Dead_42.text: Concealed buttons... Lorgan opened for me...

Refugee_Dead_28.speaker: Player
Refugee_Dead_28.text: Were you alone when you died?

Refugee_Dead_23.speaker: Brilgor
Refugee_Dead_23.text: Fists... After me... Needed to hide...

Refugee_Dead_39.speaker: Narrator
Refugee_Dead_39.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Refugee_Dead_15.speaker: Narrator
Refugee_Dead_15.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

ArguingPriest_002_0.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriest_002_0.text: Times may be hard, but the God on the Rack asks that we endure. For him.

ArguingPriest_002_1.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriest_002_1.text: Please, if you have business here, seek Sister Yannis.

ArguingPriest_002_2.speaker: Brother Clements
ArguingPriest_002_2.text: Perhaps now we can let Father Lorgan's memory rest, and honour his wishes. To keep the faith.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_31.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_31.text: Look, Investigator, Brilgor might have been a criminal, but he was no murderer. You're missing something, you have to be -
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: we begin with Yannis and Valeria arguing. Yannis is already very upset and frustrated.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_37.speaker: Valeria
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_37.text: Enough, Yannis! Listen to yourself. You are defending a man who ritually slaughtered your high priest.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_57.speaker: Valeria
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_57.text: The evidence speaks for itself. Brilgor killed Father Lorgan, then be it out of shame, or profane duty, offed himself with the same blade. Case closed, Sister Yannis.
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hollyphant stops circling yannis, delivers the line "case closed," and then begins to leave

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_18.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_18.text: Shitey little elephant. Oh, um. I apologise, stranger, language like that hardly befits a rector of Ilmater.
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'shitey little elephant' directed at valeria (who is offstage), 'oh' turns to player

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_17.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_17.text: Sounded like you were having quite the disagreement.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_56.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_56.text: Thank you. I normally wouldn't speak so harshly, but these are rather unique circumstances.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_23.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_23.text: Don't apologise, sounded like a load of bollocks anyway.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_79.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_79.text: I wouldn't go that far, but the Investigator is being particularly challenging right now.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_20.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_20.text: Don't apologise. Brilgor couldn't have killed Father Lorgan. He doesn't fit the killer's profile.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_72.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_72.text: I don't imagine Ilmater cares about you swearing.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_29.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_29.text: Given the circumstances, I think Ilmater will forgive you. My god would.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_41.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_41.text: He who shoulders the suffering of others can never be weak. But...

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_36.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_36.text: Thank you, friend. I am grateful for your compassion.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_32.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_32.text: Better to occasionally contradict one's morals than to have none. That being said...

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_15.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_15.text: I suppose you're right. The Crying One has much more on his plate than curse words, given what just happened here.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_9.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_9.text: Ah, yes, Father Lorgan's passing. My condolences.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_40.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_40.text: Two people just died on temple grounds. Our high priest, Father Lorgan, and one of the new refugees, Brilgor.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_4.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_4.text: Investigator Valeria thinks it a murder, and is content to blame Brilgor. The politically convenient target.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_59.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_59.text: If you think the Investigator did a shoddy job, I can look into the murder for you.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_1.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_1.text: Brilgor was a refugee. No one sticks up for them at the best of times, and with Gortash in power...

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_80.speaker: Jaheira
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_80.text: They make a fine target for the real culprit, too - unlikely to be missed where they weren't wanted to begin with.
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_80.context: NodeContext: Quietly cynical - she has her experience of investigating murders. Distaste for the city's rejection of refugees.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_77.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_77.text: Well, I expect the Flaming Fist will ban refugee aid now one of them's blamed for murder.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_66.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_66.text: Let me help you - I'll look around, see if there's anything to prove Brilgor innocent.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_0.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_0.text: Feel free to look around the temple - but fair warning. The Investigator won't change her mind without significant new evidence.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_6.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_6.text: Where can I find the Investigator?

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_8.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_8.text: Sharess' Caress would be my best bet. That's her usual haunt after 'closing' a case.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_19.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_19.text: Any idea what I should be looking for?

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_60.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_60.text: Valeria never found the murder weapon, so that could be a start. Anything disproving the refugee murder-suicide angle, really.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_78.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_78.text: Can you tell me where to find Shirra Clarwen?

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_33.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_33.text: I can tell you where to find her, but she won't be very chatty, I'm afraid.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_2.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_2.text: Shirra passed away last year - peacefully, mind. We buried her in the crypt under the temple, if you wish to visit.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_21.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_21.text: I really hope you find something. For all our sakes.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_68.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_68.text: I'm sure there are plenty of people from Baldur's Gate who still need your help.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_44.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_44.text: You think Ilmater looks at a Baldurian differently to anyone else? I like to think the gods are smarter than that.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_53.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_53.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I've a temple to run and a high priest to replace.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_39.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_39.text: Stick to being a place of worship. Helping people got your high priest killed.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_52.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_52.text: If we don't help them, who will? The kind Lord Gortash? Don't make me laugh.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_67.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_67.text: Aiding others is Ilmater's will. If I proved Brilgor's innocence, would that help?

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_75.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_75.text: No murder story I've ever read has ended simply - I bet there's more afoot here.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_62.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_62.text: Allow me to help you - my god would bid me aid a follower of Ilmater.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_26.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_26.text: I may not care for the Crying God, but I see your turmoil, priest. Let me help.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_63.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_63.text: It would be a delicious irony if the hollyphant - a celestial - was wrong. I'll look into it.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_30.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_30.text: You doubt her verdict. I will investigate - see where the true blame falls.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_22.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_22.text: If there's a trail to follow, I can track it. Let me look into it.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_76.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_76.text: You should worry more about your temple's safety than this 'Brilgor' person.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_42.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_42.text: I am worried about this temple. Ilmater wills that we try and help people. With Gortash in power...

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_51.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_51.text: Don't be disrespectful, killing is a form of worship.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_5.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_5.text: Not for any God worthy of the name.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_65.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_65.text: You mean your high priest harbouring criminals?

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_81.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_81.text: Brilgor was a criminal, sure, but there's no way he killed Lorgan.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_13.speaker: Sister Yannis
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_13.text: Investigator Valeria might be content to blame the politically convenient target, but I'm not.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_11.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_11.text: Hah! If more priests spoke muck like you I'd join a church. Nice one.

YannisAndHollyphantDetective_47.speaker: Player
YannisAndHollyphantDetective_47.text: I know how annoying planar beings can be. Especially ones from Celestia.

HollyphantDetective_2.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_2.text: You must excuse me, civilian. I have a date with the bottom of a bottle.
HollyphantDetective_2.context: InternalNodeContext: If Yannis is unavailable for some reason Valeria quickly tells you about the case and leaves.

HollyphantDetective_0.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_0.text: But of course! I just solved the murder of one Father Lorgan. Good chap, unfortunate end.

HollyphantDetective_3.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_3.text: Be thankful I just solved Father Lorgan's murder, mortal. It's put me in a good mood.

HollyphantDetective_11.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_11.text: To answer your deeply hurtful query - I am an investigator. THE investigator. Valeria, Sleuth of Helm. Pleasure to meet you.

HollyphantDetective_5.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_5.text: I was wondering more about the wings, trunk, and tusks, actually.

HollyphantDetective_20.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_20.text: And I wonder what happened to your manners, mortal.

HollyphantDetective_4.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_4.text: I never ask you lumbering, fleshy apes about your various parts and pores. The cheek.

HollyphantDetective_1.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_1.text: I won't entertain this nonsense any further. Sharess' Caress awaits.

HollyphantDetective_10.speaker: Player
HollyphantDetective_10.text: So you were investigating a murder here?

HollyphantDetective_16.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_16.text: Indeed, some Absolute refugee murdered a high priest. All very dramatic.

HollyphantDetective_12.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_12.text: You know, it's nice to meet someone in this blasted city with some manners.

HollyphantDetective_9.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_9.text: Worship - such a strong word. You're all very dramatic down here.

HollyphantDetective_6.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_6.text: Now, I refuse to dwell on anything further without a strong drink in hand. The communion wine here won't quite cut it.

HollyphantDetective_13.speaker: Valeria
HollyphantDetective_13.text: If you fancy a dram, I'm off to Sharess' Caress.

FatherLorgan_Dead_2.speaker: Narrator
FatherLorgan_Dead_2.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

FatherLorgan_Dead_19.speaker: Narrator
FatherLorgan_Dead_19.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

FatherLorgan_Dead_20.speaker: Player
FatherLorgan_Dead_20.text: What were you doing when you died?

FatherLorgan_Dead_24.speaker: Father Lorgan
FatherLorgan_Dead_24.text: Took him to tunnels... with the rest... fool... fool...

FatherLorgan_Dead_27.speaker: Narrator
FatherLorgan_Dead_27.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

FatherLorgan_Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
FatherLorgan_Dead_9.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
